title.native: 宇宙海賊キャプテンハーロック

description: Many years into the future, battle has been raging across the galaxies as 500 billion humans, whose forebears were exiled from Earth, plan to return to what is still called home. Forced to flee a ravaged Earth, humans have now depleted the corners of the galaxy to which they fled. Earth has now become the most valued and precious resource of all, controlled by the corrupt Gaia Coalition which governs the human race across the different galaxies. Captain Harlock and his trusted crew are the only hope mankind has of discovering the secrets that the Gaia have kept hidden.

tags.name: Full CGI
tags.description: Almost entirely created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Space
tags.description: Partly or completely set in outer space.

tags.name: Pirates
tags.description: Prominently features sea-faring adventurers branded as criminals by the law.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Ships
tags.description: Prominently features the use of sea-based transportation vessels.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

name.native: キャプテン・ハーロック

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/leijimatsumoto)

Matsumoto's art might take some getting used to, but he is renowned for coming up with great stories and brilliant new concepts. Debuting in 1953 with a 16 page manga "Mitsubachi no Bouken" in Manga Shounen, he has authored nearly thirty manga series.

His big break came in 1971, in the years between 53 and 71 he mostly produced Shoujo manga, much to his displeasure. In the late '70s and the early '80s, there was a big Matsumoto-boom when he drew his best known series. After that, things became more quiet around him, but the late '90s show a revival.

The trademarks of Matsumoto are his unusual artstyle, the space opera and the manly romance stories.

In 1997, Matsumoto began to create new adventures of Captain Harlock which can be admired on the Web in Japanese and in English.

One of Matsumoto Reiji's former assistants is [Sennou Knife](https://anilist.co/staff/99382), who was also an assistant of [Maki Miyako](https://anilist.co/staff/114821/). He went solo in the mid-80s and enjoyed modest success with Yami no Silhouette.

His real name is Matsumoto Akira. Reiji is a pseudonym and means something like "Zero Warrior". His name is often rendered in romaji as "Matsumoto Leiji". Matsumoto is married to Maki Miyako.

He died of heart failure on February 13, 2023 in a hospital in Tokyo.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/snjaramaki) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/荒牧伸志) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shinji_Aramaki)

Aramaki is one of the leading figures in the industry's CG animation, and is noted for his various design works in numerous anime series such as [Gasaraki](https://anilist.co/anime/782/), [Witch Hunter Robin](https://anilist.co/anime/7/), [Wolf's Rain](https://anilist.co/anime/202/) and [Soul Eater](https://anilist.co/anime/3588/) among many others.

Influenced by [Space Battleship Yamato](https://anilist.co/anime/1650/), [Mobile Suit Gundam](https://anilist.co/anime/80/), and Star Wars during his junior and senior high school years, he decided to pursue a career in film. One of his first representative works was an independently produced animation titled "Moonstruck Artemis," that he made while part of a manga club during his university days. Aramaki didn't have a special desire to work in the animation industry, but has stated joining it solely because he could draw and the industry had a wide range of options for someone like that. He has also said that the spread of digital technology has made it easier for him to work in both anime and live-action.

In 2004, Aramaki directed [Appleseed](https://anilist.co/anime/54/), a re-interpretation of a [Shirou Masamune](https://anilist.co/staff/97609/) manga by [the same name](https://anilist.co/manga/30668/). Although bashed by critics, the movie was an influential piece in the medium that had great impact on creators around the world. Studio Ghibli co-founder [Toshio Suzuki](https://anilist.co/staff/101638/) said the movie would reform the industry.

[Website](https://terra-musica.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/t2_takahashi)

Japanese composer and arranger. In 1987 he won a CM production contest together with some college friends and started his career as CM music producer afterwards. In 1996 he debuted under Toshiba EMI as singer-songwriter and continued to expand his work field further to that of arranger.

__[Website](http://www.oneokrock.com/index.html)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ONEOKROCK_japan)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/ONEOKROCKchannel)__ | __[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/ONEOKROCK)__ | __[Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/7k73EtZwoPs516ZxE72KsO)__

__Introduction:__
One Ok Rock, stylized as ONE OK ROCK is a Japanese rock band. They have been playing many different styles of music, with songs ranging from alternative rock to emo to post-hardcore to pop rock.

__Biography:__
The band's name comes from "one o'clock", the time that the band used to practice their music on weekends. They chose to play at one o'clock in the morning because it was cheaper to use the rehearsal space during such hours. However, noticing that the Japanese language made no distinction between R's and L's, "O'CLOCK" transformed into "O'CROCK" or "O'KROCK", which later transformed into "OK ROCK". In addition, One Ok Rock can be expressed as "10969" (wan-ō-ku-ro-ku). This band makes their music in Japanese, English and mainly in a mixture of both of the languages.

__Members:__
Name: Tooru Yamashita
Birthplace: Osaka Prefecture, Japan
Roles: Leader and guitarist of the group

Name: [Takahiro Moriuchi](https://anilist.co/staff/159554/Takahiro-Moriuchi)
Date of Birth: April 17, 1988
Birthplace: Tokyo, Japan
Role: Main vocalist of the group

Name: Ryouta Kohama
Date of Birth: September 4, 1989
Birthplace: Osaka Prefecture, Japan
Role: Bassist of the group

Name: Tomoya Kanki
Date of Birth: June 27, 1987
Birthplace: Hyogo Prefecture, Japan
Role: Drummer of the group

__[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/10969taka/)__

__Takahiro Moriuchi__, alternatively known by his stage name Taka is a Japanese lyricist, composer and main vocalist of rock band [ONE OK ROCK](https://anilist.co/staff/126954).

__[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/10969taka/)__

__Takahiro Moriuchi__, alternatively known by his stage name Taka is a Japanese lyricist, composer and main vocalist of rock band [ONE OK ROCK](https://anilist.co/staff/126954).

Website Date of Birth: December 19, 1973 Birthplace: Takasaki City, Gunma Prefecture, Japan __Introduction:__ Suzuki Akihito, also known as Akkin, is a Japanese composer, arranger, guitarist and music producer. __Biography:__ He's a former guitarist for the band Heart Bazaar, which is also the band he made a major debut with in the year of 2000. He would later make his actual debut with the band jet, through the record label TOY'S FACTORY. (Source: Wikipedia)

__Introduction:__

__Biography:__
The band's name comes from "one o'clock", the time that the band used to practice their music on weekends. They chose to play at one o'clock in the morning because it was cheaper to use the rehearsal space during such hours. However, noticing that the Japanese language made no distinction between R's and L's, "O'CLOCK" transformed into "O'CROCK" or "O'KROCK", which later transformed into "OK ROCK". In addition, One Ok Rock can be expressed as "10969" (wan-ō-ku-ro-ku). This band makes their music in Japanese, English and mainly in a mixture of both of the languages.

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/rodrigo_andreatto) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/RAndreatto97180) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100048044331160)

Rodrigo Andreatto Vieira da Costa is a Brazilian actor, voice actor, singer, narrator, and dubbing director. He is married to the voice actress [Priscila Franco](https://anilist.co/staff/109483/), older brother of [Andressa Andreatto](https://anilist.co/staff/177268/) and father of 
Sofia Andreatto.

__Non-Anime Roles:__
~!- Kendall Knight (Big Time Rush)
- Theodore Seville (Alvin and the Chipmunks movies)
- Corbin Bleu (Most of the productions)
- Chad Danforth (High School Musical trilogy and High School Musical: The Musical: The Series)
- Mobius M. Mobius (2nd voice - Since Quantumania; Marvel Cinematic Universe)
- Wallace Wells (Scott Pilgrim vs. The World)
- Bradley "Brad" Buttowski (Kick Buttowski: Suburban Daredevil)
- Eli Shane (SlugTerra)
- Dib Membrane (Invader ZIM and Invader Zim: Enter the Florpus)
- Officer Benjamin Clawhauser (Zootopia and Zootopia+)
- Okita Sōgo (Gintama 2: Rules are Made to be Broken)
- Jack Dawson (2nd dub; Titanic)
- Iago (Aladdin Live Action and Once Upon a Studio)
- Rodrick Heffley (Diary of a Wimpy Kid: Rodrick Rules and Diary of a Wimpy Kid: Dog Days)
- Rupert (Rupert)
- Flint Lockwood (Cloudy: The Series)
- Dave (Dave the Barbarian)
- Chuck (1st dub; Hjælp, jeg er en fisk)
- Ronald Bilius "Ron" Weasley (Harry Potter games)
!~

Twitter | Instagram Arturo Castañeda Mendoza is a Mexican voice actor. He is known for being the Latin American Spanish voice of Barry Allen / Flash in the DC Extended Universe, Mike Chang in Glee and Justin Russo in Wizards of Waverly Place. He's the son of Mario Castañeda and Rommy Mendoza and the brother of Carla Castañeda. Non-Anime Roles: - Mercury (Smite)
